description: Visitor Visa (VIVIS) for Tourism / Family Visit to Brazil. Using official e-Consular + embassy submission workflow for Indian applicants.

meta.fee_usd_approx: 80 USD (~₹7,500-8,500) — as per current consular fee for Indian applicants
meta.max_stay: Up to 90 days (single or multiple entries depending on grant)  :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}
meta.passport_validity: At least 6 months beyond date of arrival  :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}
meta.photo_spec: Standard passport-size (as per Brazil Embassy’s guidelines), recent, white background  :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}
meta.min_funds_requirement: Proof of sufficient funds — bank statements / income proof (no publicly published fixed amount). Embassy guidelines emphasise proof of economic means / return ticket + accommodation.  :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}

documents.title: Valid Passport
documents.description: Original passport valid for at least 6 months from date of entry, with 2 blank pages. Include copies of first page + any used pages with visas/stamps if required.

documents.title: RER Receipt (Visa Application Form)
documents.description: Filled-in online visa application (SCEDV), printed and signed. This is mandatory to present at embassy/consulate.  :contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}

documents.title: Proof of Financial Means
documents.description: Recent bank statements (3-6 months), payslips or ITR for salaried/self-employed. Should demonstrate enough funds for stay + return ticket + expenses.

documents.title: Travel Itinerary & Accommodation Proof
documents.description: Confirmed flight reservation (return or onward) + hotel booking or proof of stay / address in Brazil.

documents.title: Cover / Motivation Letter
documents.description: Brief letter explaining purpose of visit, travel plan, intended duration, and commitment to exit Brazil before visa expiry.

steps_flow.title: Fill Online Visa Application (SCEDV)
steps_flow.description: Complete the online visa form on Brazil’s official portal. Print the form and sign it before submission.  :contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}

steps_flow.title: Book Appointment via e-Consular
steps_flow.description: Create account on the official e-Consular booking system for the Brazil Embassy/Consulate in India (New Delhi / Mumbai). Submit scanned documents and required data digitally.  :contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}

steps_flow.title: Pay Visa Fee & Collect Payment Receipt
steps_flow.description: After validation, pay the visa fee (as instructed) — typically via bank transfer / deposit to consulate-account (not cash). Keep payment receipt.  :contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}

steps_flow.title: Visit Embassy/Consulate & Submit Original Documents
steps_flow.description: Carry passport, printed & signed RER, payment receipt, financial proof, travel plan & accommodation details, photos. Submit all originals + documents as per check-list.  :contentReference[oaicite:11]{index=11}

steps_flow.title: Processing & Collect Passport/Visa
steps_flow.description: Wait 10-15 working days for processing. Once approved, collect passport with visa stamp (valid for up to 90 days stay).  :contentReference[oaicite:12]{index=12}
